str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul. From time and theos; dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Soon, quickly, hastily. Adverb from tachus; briefly, i.e. speedily, or rapidly.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be of good cheer. From a compound of eu and psuche; to be in good spirits, i.e. Feel encouraged.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
